availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Father of Hugh Wallace. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1850. Farmer in Crittenden County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Crittenden County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 246A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, District 1, p. 353.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, West half of county, p. 395.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden County, West half of county, p. 360A.
Find A Grave, "William Wallace (December 12, 1804-May 05, 1875)," Memorial #64445989, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/64445989/ (accessed January 30, 2019).
